title: \\\\\\\ Interesting Typeface from Mexico City Metro, but what is it? does anyone know? hmm /////////
content:
Hello everyone,

Does anyone know of this typeface, which is used by the Mexico City Metro line. Which is the 2nd largest subway network behind New York in North America? I've tried many sources and about to exhaust all avenues.

Thanks everyone,

Keisuke

comments.content: This must surely be customised letters for this logotype. Similar style could be found at House Industries. Check out their typeface family Chalet.

[metro DF](http://web.archive.org/web/20110616144643/http:/www.haroldsfonts.com/metro.html) by Harold Lohner was inspired by this look:

_»METRO-DF was inspired by a trip to Mexico City. The official signage of the Mexico City subway uses a peculiar adaptation of the classic font Eurostile, designed by Aldo Novarese. The capital E was most unusual. The overall feel was of a past vision of the future, with a distinctively Mexican touch. (The squared circle, or rounded square, is very common in both old and new Mexican design.«_
////// thanks guys for the information, life saver //////
